Diagnosis
	1. Merkel cell carcinoma of right lower leg with bone metastases
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative - Disease control

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Wide local excision of primary lesion

	Radiotherapy
	12 Feb 2024 - 26 Feb 2024 Palliative radiotherapy to T12 vertebral metastasis

	Chemotherapy
	Not indicated as first-line therapy

	Clinical studies
	Enrolled in MERKLIN-2 trial of dual checkpoint inhibition

	Current disease status
	Stable metastatic disease

	Current issues
	Mild fatigue, controlled bone pain

	Summary of consultation
	This 72-year-old gentleman has been reviewed today for registration in the MERKLIN-2 trial. He was diagnosed in January 2024 with a 3.2cm Merkel cell carcinoma on his right lower leg, which was initially treated with wide local excision. Subsequent staging revealed metastatic disease to T12 vertebra, treated with palliative radiotherapy. Molecular analysis shows the tumor is MCPyV negative with high PD-L1 expression (90% CPS).

He has completed all screening investigations including cardiac echo (normal), baseline CT chest/abdomen/pelvis showing stable disease, and brain MRI showing no metastases. Blood tests including hepatitis screen, HIV, and autoimmune profile are all satisfactory for trial entry. His performance status remains 1.

I have discussed the trial protocol in detail, including the randomization process, treatment schedule, and potential side effects of dual checkpoint inhibition. He understands the additional monitoring requirements and has signed the informed consent forms.

	Further investigations
	Baseline trial-mandated blood tests completed

	Medication prescribed
	Trial medication to commence as per protocol

	Follow up
	First trial treatment scheduled for 25 April 2024
Weekly review for first 12 weeks as per protocol

	Required GP actions
	Alert trial team if any new symptoms or concurrent medications
Weekly blood tests as per protocol schedule provided

	Summary of information given to the patient
	Trial protocol handbook provided
Trial team contact details given
Alert card for immunotherapy side effects provided
